meanings.definition: To change the course of a sailing vessel by tacking through the wind.
meanings.sent1: The sailors boxhauled the ship to navigate around the storm.
meanings.sent2: The captain boxhauled the sailboat to catch the favorable wind.
meanings.sent3: Trying to boxhaul the huge ship in a tiny pond would be quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: She boxhauled her life in a new direction after the inspiring journey.
meanings.sent5: The ship boxhauled gracefully, like a dancer twirling on the sea.

meanings.definition: To pull or drag something forcefully in a straight line.
meanings.sent1: The workers boxhauled the heavy crate across the warehouse floor.
meanings.sent2: He boxhauled the fallen tree out of the way with determination.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to boxhaul the leash, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: She boxhauled her suitcase up the stairs, one step at a time.
meanings.sent5: The tractor boxhauled the trailer up the steep hill effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To maneuver or handle something awkwardly or clumsily.
meanings.sent1: He boxhauled the fragile vase, almost dropping it in his haste.
meanings.sent2: She boxhauled the stack of books, causing them to topple over.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to boxhaul the slippery fish, making a mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The toddler boxhauled the puzzle pieces, struggling to fit them together.
meanings.sent5: The new employee boxhauled the task, unsure of the correct procedure.
